lineage.Process: Merge PopulatedPlaces_for_CWM;D:\Data\CWM\gadm_v2_shp\missing_points.shp D:\Data\CWM\gadm_v2_shp\PopulatedPlaces_for_CWM_v2.shp "NAME "NAME" true true false 128 Text 0 0 ,First,#,PopulatedPlaces_for_CWM,NAME,-1,-1,D:\Data\CWM\gadm_v2_shp\missing_points.shp,Name,-1,-1;City_ID "City_ID" true true false 4 Short 0 4 ,First,#,PopulatedPlaces_for_CWM,City_ID,-1,-1,D:\Data\CWM\gadm_v2_shp\missing_points.shp,City_ID,-1,-1"

Merge CWM_City_centroids_v7;D:\Data\gadm_v2_shp\place_ply_2_missing_as_points.shp D:\Data\gadm_v2_shp\CWM_City_centroids_v8.shp "NAME "NAME" true true false 128 Text 0 0 ,First,#,CWM_City_centroids_v7,NAME,-1,-1,D:\Data\gadm_v2_shp\place_ply_2_missing_as_points.shp,NAME,-1,-1;City_ID "City_ID" true true false 4 Short 0 4 ,First,#,CWM_City_centroids_v7,City_ID,-1,-1,D:\Data\gadm_v2_shp\place_ply_2_missing_as_points.shp,City_ID,-1,-1;ISOURBID "ISOURBID" true true false 50 Text 0 0 ,First,#,CWM_City_centroids_v7,ISOURBID,-1,-1;FIRST_NAME "FIRST_NAME" true true false 35 Text 0 0 ,First,#,CWM_City_centroids_v7,FIRST_NAME,-1,-1;FIRST_SCHN "FIRST_SCHN" true true false 35 Text 0 0 ,First,#,CWM_City_centroids_v7,FIRST_SCHN,-1,-1;WUP_code "WUP_code" true true false 9 Long 0 9 ,First,#,CWM_City_centroids_v7,WUP_code,-1,-1"

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: World Populated Places represents the populated places as points in the world.
descript.purpose: World Populated Places provides a base map layer for populated places of the world.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:250,000.

The redistribution rights for this data set: Redistribution rights are granted by the data vendor for hard-copy renditions or static, electronic map images (e.g. .gif, .jpeg, etc.) that are plotted, printed, or publicly displayed with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s).
The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on ESRI Data & Maps.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

enttyp.enttypd: The centroids of cities in the CWM alpha release

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The unique identifier for the city in the CWM.
A concatenated string of the three letter alpha code for country plus the URBID defined in the Global Rural/Urban Mapping Project (GRUMP) dataset.
The unique identifier used by the UNPD in its World Population Prospects dataset.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

serinfo.sername: A subset of DeLorme World Base Map (DWBM).

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded the data set from the Delorme FTP site. Renamed field LABEL to NAME. Added field TYPE and calculated its values using the source DFCC code and descriptive look up table. Added field RANK and calculated its values based on the source field LOI which numerically ranks feature importance using a DeLorme numbering scheme. Deleted all fields except NAME, TYPE, and RANK. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: The level of detail for each feature is generally better than what is traditionally utilized in a 1:500,000 scale product. The positional accuracy is typical of a 1:100,000 scale map, or +/-50 meters 95% of the time.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

attracc.attraccr: All data has been reviewed for correct application of attributes and is accurate to current conditions.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

idCitation.resTitle: Centroids of cities served by DVTRs

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The centroids of cities in the CWM. Derived from an ESRI later, World Populated Places, which represents the populated places as points in the world, which in turn was derived from Delorme's dataset, which in turn appears to be derived from the Digital Chart of the World.

descKeys.keyword: point, populated places, cities, capitals, towns, location, society

dataIdInfo.idPurp: To show the approprimate center of the cities served by DVTRs. Note that some cities are served by multiple DVTRs, and some DVTRs serve multiple cities.

Consts.useLimit: To be used only consistent with the overall constraints on using the City Water Map.
